intro: Macaranga carrii, commonly known as the white-veined macaranga, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves with prominent white veins. The plant is often found in tropical rainforests, growing as an understory shrub or small tree. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-yellow in color, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Macaranga carrii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and animals.
